headline: Home Depot forecasts steeper drop in annual profit, shares fall
summary:
STORY: Shares of Home Depot slid as much as 5% on Tuesday, after the world's top home-improvement chain missed quarterly earnings estimates and forecast a bigger drop in full-year profit.

The shift in tone from the company comes as tariff-driven economic uncertainty stalls big-ticket renovations and do-it-yourself projects.

Home Depot executives said that a widely expected pick-up in demand from easing U.S. interest and mortgage rates had failed to materialize, likely amplifying concerns over a slowing economy.

Home Depot got the ball rolling in a week packed with earnings reports from big-box retailers, including Walmart and Target.

Their results should offer key insights into U.S. consumer spending with prices remaining elevated heading into the all-important holiday season.

Shares of Home Depot rival Lowe's, which also reports results this week, fell more than two and a half percent on Tuesday.

content.title: Home Depot forecasts steeper drop in annual profit, shares fall
content.summary:

Home Depot got the ball rolling in a week packed with earnings reports from big-box retailers, including Walmart and Target.

Shares of Home Depot rival Lowe's, which also reports results this week, fell more than two and a half percent on Tuesday.

headline: Target's biggest retail challenges ahead of Q3 earnings
summary: As Home Depot (HD) stock slides on Tuesday morning after releasing mixed third quarter results and cutting its full-year outlook, Target (TGT) is the next chain retailer to release its quarterly results on Wednesday. Portfolio Wealth Advisors president and CIO Lee Munson shares his expert perspective on Target's biggest challenges as it competes with other retail giants, while Yahoo Finance senior reporter Brooke DiPalma outlines Home Depot's own obstacles in navigating a sluggish housing market and slowdown in home improvement projects. Also watch The Consumer Collective's Jessica Ramirez explain to Yahoo Finance why Walmart (WMT) has an advantage that Target used to have. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: Walmart stock investors brace for earnings
summary: Over the past 20 years, Walmart has faced stiff challenges from e-commerce (Amazon) and big-box brick-and-mortar retailers (Target). At times, its retail dominance has been questioned, leading to investors selling shares. Recently, however, doubts have quieted, and Walmart's stock price has soared. ...
